factoid: Rays of gentle light shone from Princess Mary's large, timid eyes.
The light from Princess Mary's eyes illuminated her thin, sickly face.
The illumination made Princess Mary's face beautiful.
Princess Mary's brother would have taken the icon.
Princess Mary stopped her brother from taking the icon.
Prince Andrew understood the situation.
Prince Andrew crossed himself.
Prince Andrew kissed the icon.
Prince Andrew had a look of tenderness.
Prince Andrew was touched.
Prince Andrew had a gleam of irony on his face.
Prince Andrew said "Thank you, my dear."
Princess Mary kissed Prince Andrew on the forehead.
Princess Mary sat down again on the sofa.
Princess Mary and Prince Andrew were silent for a while.
Princess Mary told Prince Andrew to be kind and generous as he used to be.
Princess Mary told Prince Andrew not to judge Lise harshly.
Princess Mary said Lise is sweet and good-natured.
Princess Mary said Lise's position is very hard.
Prince Andrew said he does not think he has complained of his wife to Másha or blamed her.
Prince Andrew asked why Másha says all this to him.
Red patches appeared on Princess Mary's face.
Princess Mary was silent as if she felt guilty.
Prince Andrew said he has said nothing to you but you have already been talked to.
Prince Andrew apologized for that.
The patches grew deeper on Princess Mary's forehead, neck, and cheeks.
Princess Mary tried to say something but could not.
Princess Mary's brother guessed that the little princess had been crying after dinner.
The little princess had spoken of her forebodings about her confinement.
The little princess had dreaded her confinement.
The little princess had complained of her fate, her father-in-law, and her husband.
After crying, the little princess fell asleep.
Prince Andrew felt sorry for his sister.
Prince Andrew said he cannot reproach his wife with anything.
Prince Andrew said he cannot reproach himself regarding his wife.
Prince Andrew said he will never reproach his wife in whatever circumstances.
Prince Andrew said he does not know why she is unhappy.
Prince Andrew said he does not know if he is happy.
Prince Andrew said he does not know if she is happy.
Prince Andrew rose and went to his sister and kissed her forehead.
Prince Andrew's fine eyes lit up with thoughtful, kind, unaccustomed brightness.
Prince Andrew looked not at his sister but over her head toward the darkness of the open doorway.
Prince Andrew told his valet Petrúshka to go to her, say goodbye, or go and wake and he'll come in a moment.
Prince Andrew called his valet Petrúshka to take away things and put them on the seat.
Princess Mary rose and moved to the door, then stopped and said "Andrew if you had faith you would have turned to God and asked Him to give you love you do not feel."
Prince Andrew replied "Well, maybe!"
Prince Andrew told Másha he will come immediately.
On the way to his sister's room, Prince Andrew met Mademoiselle Bourienne smiling sweetly.
It was the third time that day that Mademoiselle Bourienne met Prince Andrew in secluded passages.
Mademoiselle Bourienne said she thought Prince Andrew was in his room.
Prince Andrew looked sternly at Mademoiselle Bourienne and had an expression of anger.
Prince Andrew said nothing to Mademoiselle Bourienne but looked at her forehead and hair without looking at her eyes with contempt.
Mademoiselle Bourienne blushed and went away without a word.
When Prince Andrew reached his sister's room, his wife was already awake.
His wife's merry voice, hurrying one word after another, came through the open door.
His wife was speaking as usual in French.
His wife wished to make up for lost time after long self-restraint.
Prince Andrew said "No, but imagine the old Countess Zúbova, with false curls and mouth full of false teeth, as if she were trying to cheat old age."
Prince Andrew laughed "Ha, ha, ha! Mary!"
Prince Andrew had heard this sentence about Countess Zúbova and laugh from his wife in presence of others five times.
Prince Andrew entered the room softly.
The little princess was plump and rosy.
The little princess was sitting in an easy chair with her work in her hands.
The little princess was talking incessantly, repeating Petersburg reminiscences and phrases.
Prince Andrew came up, stroked the little princess's hair, and asked if she felt rested after their journey.
The little princess answered Prince Andrew and continued her chatter.
